info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 12:09PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Elbert and southeastern Abbeville Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1209 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles southwest of Abbeville, or near Lake Strom Thurmond, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Calhoun Falls, Bobby Brown State Park, Lake Strom Thurmond, Lake Russell, Richard B Russell Dam, Rice Town and Bobby Brown State Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
